page.title: 08BRACEBRIDGE HEATH RESERVOIR
page.content:
In 1904/5 a typhoid epidemic in Lincoln resulted in 131 deaths. Contaminated water supplies were blamed and it was necessary to improve the quality of the supply. A new source of supply at Elkesley, Notts was used and from 1911 to the present day water pumped from Elkesley goes into Westgate water tower with the surplus passed by gravitation to Bracebridge Heath Reservoir. It is a covered Reservoir with a capacity of six million gallons which serves the low districts of Lincoln as well as Bracebridge Heath and R.A.F. Waddington. It has recently had a booster station fitted and been linked to Leaderham service reservoir.
From Information Supplied by Anglian Water.
